body_html:
If the problem is with non-Tensor arguments, then don't you have to do the same with padding_value?

To be honest I'm really worried about what's happening to this rnn code. In its current form it will be impossible to ever do any reasonable refactors, because it's so deeply entangled with ONNX, and this dependencies are completely invisible 😕
body_text:

To be honest I'm really worried about what's happening to this rnn code. In its current form it will be impossible to ever do any reasonable refactors, because it's so deeply entangled with ONNX, and this dependencies are completely invisible 😕
body:
If the problem is with non-Tensor arguments, then don't you have to do the same with `padding_value`?

To be honest I'm really worried about what's happening to this rnn code. In its current form it will be impossible to ever do any reasonable refactors, because it's so deeply entangled with ONNX, and this dependencies are completely invisible 😕
